metro.TrainManagement.Lines

Class TrainLine

  • java.lang.Object
    • metro.TrainManagement.Lines.TrainLine

  • public class TrainLine
extends java.lang.Object
    A Train line is a collection of several railway connections that touches each other (building one big line) or mostly touching each other (building an invalid line). Trains can only move on one of this train lines. To create a line, the TrainLineSelectTool is used to select different nodes, put them into connections and building this line. A train line in immutable which means that the line stays sorted as it is. To change something you have to create a new line. "Sorted" means that there're no jumps in the connections (e.g. (0,1) -> (0,5) -> (0,3) but (0,1) -> (0,3) -> (0,5) ). An invalid line (= a line with gaps) is partly sorted, so every part is sorted in itself. The order of these parts must not be sorted.
    Author:
    hauke

      • sortNodes

        private java.util.ArrayList<RailwayNode> sortNodes(java.util.ArrayList<RailwayNode> list,
                                         RailwayNode startNode)
        Sorts the given list of nodes by choosing one start node an then the neighbors.
        Parameters:
        list - The list of nodes that should be sorted.
        startNode - An end node of the line.
        Returns:
        A sorted list with all the nodes.

      • getAnyEndNode

        private RailwayNode getAnyEndNode(java.util.ArrayList<RailwayNode> list)
        This method determines an end node of the given line. It's not specified which node of the two end nodes will be chosen, because the algorithm will take the first in the list of nodes.
        Parameters:
        list - A list with all nodes where the end nodes should be determined.
        Returns:
        One of the two end nodes of the given line.

      • calcLength

        private double calcLength()
        Calculates the length of the train line. The length is scaled by the METRO.__baseNetSpacing and is NOT given in pixel.
        Returns:
        The length of the train line.

      • calcPartLength

        private double calcPartLength(int startNode,
                    int endNode)
        calculates the distance between two nodes.
        Parameters:
        startNode - The index of the start node.
        endNode - The index of the end node.
        Returns:
        The distance between them.

      • getPositionOfTrain

        public java.awt.geom.Point2D getPositionOfTrain(double distance,
                                       int startNode)
        Calculates the position of a train that traveled a specific distance from the start node. The idea of searching the position is to find two nodes that are around the distance. (E.g. the distance is 5 and one node is at 4.5 and one at 5.5). There's a detailed explanation about the calculation in the methods body.
        Parameters:
        distance - The traveled distance of a train.
        startNode - The index of the node the train started.
        Returns:
        The position of the train.

      • contains

        public boolean contains(RailwayNode node)
        Checks if a node is included in this train line.
        Parameters:
        node - The node that's possibly in here.
        Returns:
        True if the node is already included.

      • setName

        public void setName(java.lang.String newName)
        Updates the name of this train line.
        Parameters:
        newName - The new name.

      • isValid

        public static boolean isValid(java.util.ArrayList<RailwayNode> listOfNodes)
        Check if this train line is a valid line. A line is valid when both of the following conditions apply: 1.) There're more than 2 nodes in this line. 2.) There're exactly 2 end/start nodes in this line. These nodes only have one neighbor. 3.) All non-end-nodes have exactly two neighbors (no crossing allowed).
        Parameters:
        listOfNodes - The list of nodes that may be valid.
        Returns:
        True when valid.

      • isEndNode

        public static boolean isEndNode(RailwayNode node,
                java.util.ArrayList<RailwayNode> listOfNodes)
        Checks if the given node is one of the end nodes in the list of given nodes.
        Parameters:
        node - The node that's probably an end node.
        listOfNodes - The list of all available nodes.
        Returns:
        True when the given node is an end node, false if not.

        Returns:

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object o)
        Checks if two lines are equal. They are equal when line A has the same nodes as B. The order of the nodes doesn't matter.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object

      • draw

        public void draw(java.awt.Point offset,
        com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.SpriteBatch sp,
        java.util.HashMap<RailwayNode,java.lang.Integer> map)
        Draws the train line. The line doesn't need to be valid because all parts are drawn by their own.
        Parameters:
        offset - The map offset in pixel.
        sp - The sprite batch to draw on.
        map - A map (node -> Integer) that says how many lines are already drawn on this node (normally all integers are 0).
